Threat Scenario: Confused deputy: untrusted user prompt leads agent to execute privileged tool actions
Recommended Mitigation: Policy engine enforces user permissions + intent binding + deny-by-default

Threat Scenario: Approval bypass: high-risk actions executed without step-up approval/HITL
Recommended Mitigation: Action risk classification + mandatory approval gates + audit trail

Threat Scenario: Parameter injection into tools (SQL/command/SSRF) via LLM-crafted inputs
Recommended Mitigation: Strict schema validation + allowlisted params + safe SDKs + output encoding

Threat Scenario: Tool endpoint spoofing (DNS/URL manipulation) routes calls to attacker infra
Recommended Mitigation: Hard allowlist base URLs + egress controls + DNS protections

Threat Scenario: Executor/service identity has broader privileges than user (privilege mismatch)
Recommended Mitigation: Per-user scoped tokens + least-priv tool identities + token exchange

Threat Scenario: Agent loops cause tool-call amplification and cost spikes
Recommended Mitigation: Max tool calls per request + time budgets + circuit breakers + caching

Threat Scenario: Memory poisoning biases future actions or bypasses safety constraints
Recommended Mitigation: Sanitize memory writes + bounded retention + integrity/audit + separate “trusted state”

Threat Scenario: Sensitive tool results leaked in response or logs
Recommended Mitigation: Output filtering + data classification + redaction + least-priv tools

Threat Scenario: Secrets exposed to LLM via prompt/context or tool results
Recommended Mitigation: Never pass secrets to LLM + secret scanning + token exchange patterns

Threat Scenario: Session/token spoofing triggers actions as another user
Recommended Mitigation: Strong auth + session binding + step-up auth for sensitive actions

Threat Scenario: Insufficient evidence trail for who approved/executed actions and why
Recommended Mitigation: Immutable audit logs + action IDs + policy decisions + timestamps

Threat Scenario: CI/CD compromise modifies policies/allowlists/prompts to enable dangerous actions
Recommended Mitigation: Signed builds + protected branches + separation of duties + secret isolation
